text: Portrait of Reynaud, engraving after a portrait by Madame Reynaud Reynaud's grave in Père Lachaise Cemetery, Paris, with sculpture by Henri Chapu Jean Reynaud (14 February 1806, Lyon – 28 June 1863, Paris) was a French socialist philosopher. He was a member of the Saint-Simonian community. He was a co- founder of the Encyclopédie nouvelle. ==References== * David Albert Griffiths, ', Paris : M.
